skill.name: requesting-code-review
skill.description: Use when completing tasks, implementing major features, or before merging to verify work meets requirements
skill.summary: Use when completing tasks, implementing major features, or before merging to verify work meets requi...
skill.author: Cycleaddict

security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill containing markdown files with code review guidelines and prompt templates. No executable code, no file system access, no network calls, no command execution.

content.value_statement: Manual code review is time-consuming and inconsistent. This skill dispatches a structured code-reviewer subagent to systematically evaluate code changes against requirements, architecture standards, and production readiness criteria.
actual_capabilities: Dispatch structured code-reviewer subagent with defined parameters
Compare implementation against plan or requirements documents
Evaluate code quality, architecture, and testing coverage
Categorize issues by severity: Critical, Important, Minor
Assess production readiness with clear verdict
Provide specific file:line references with fix recommendations
limitations: Does not execute code or run tests directly
Cannot access external systems or APIs for integration testing
Review quality depends on git diff and provided documentation
Cannot make changes to code; only provides feedback

use_cases.title: Review completed tasks
use_cases.description: After each task in subagent-driven development, catch issues before they compound across tasks

use_cases.title: Pre-merge quality gate
use_cases.description: Review code before merging to main branch ensuring requirements are met and architecture is sound

use_cases.title: Fresh perspective on stuck code
use_cases.description: When stuck on a problem, get objective feedback from a systematic code review perspective

prompt_templates.title: Basic Review Request
prompt_templates.prompt: Review the code I just implemented. Use the code-reviewer subagent. What was implemented: {WHAT_WAS_IMPLEMENTED}. Plan or requirements: {PLAN_OR_REQUIREMENTS}. Base commit: {BASE_SHA}. Head commit: {HEAD_SHA}.

prompt_templates.title: Feature Review
prompt_templates.prompt: I completed a major feature. Request a code review using the requesting-code-review skill. Fill in: What was built: {WHAT_WAS_IMPLEMENTED}. Requirements: {PLAN_OR_REQUIREMENTS}. Git range from {BASE_SHA} to {HEAD_SHA}.

prompt_templates.title: Pre-merge Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Before merging to main, run a code review. Use superpowers:code-reviewer subagent with the full template from requesting-code-review/code-reviewer.md. Base: origin/main, Head: HEAD.

prompt_templates.title: Comprehensive Assessment
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform comprehensive code review before production release. Use code-reviewer template. Include checking: code quality, architecture, security concerns, testing, migration strategy, backward compatibility, and documentation. Output strengths, issues by severity, and clear assessment.

output_examples.input: Review Task 2: Add verification function for conversation index
output: - Clean architecture with proper separation of concerns
- Comprehensive test coverage for all 4 issue types
- Good error handling with descriptive messages
- Missing progress indicators (indexer.ts:130) - Users don't know operation progress
- No timeout handling for long-running verifications
- Magic number (100) for reporting interval should be configurable
- Could add more inline comments for edge case logic
Ready to proceed after adding progress indicators

best_practices: Review after each task, not just before merge, to catch issues early
Always get git SHAs (BASE_SHA and HEAD_SHA) for accurate diff review
Act on feedback: fix Critical issues immediately, Important issues before proceeding
anti_patterns: Skipping review because code seems simple - small bugs compound
Ignoring Critical issues and proceeding anyway
Being vague in feedback without specific file:line references

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code through the Task tool using superpowers:code-reviewer type.

faq.question: What git information is required?
faq.answer: You need BASE_SHA (starting commit) and HEAD_SHA (ending commit) to generate the git diff for review.

faq.question: Does this run tests automatically?
faq.answer: No. The skill reviews code through git diff and documentation. It checks if tests exist and cover logic but does not execute them.

faq.question: Is my code data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only reads git diff output locally. No code is sent to external services or stored anywhere.

faq.question: Why use this over manual review?
faq.answer: Systematic checklist ensures nothing is missed, consistent criteria across reviews, faster initial feedback, and clear severity categorization.

faq.question: How is this different from linting tools?
faq.answer: Linting checks style and syntax. This skill evaluates architecture, design decisions, requirements coverage, and production readiness beyond what tools can detect.
